business.headline: India's semiconductor boom: These stocks could be your best pickThe development of the semiconductor value chain—ranging from chip design to manufacturing and assembly, is expected to benefit various companies in the sector.

Sensex gains 1,500 points on US rate cut optimism; Granules India tanks 17%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 1,439.55 points to 82,962.71 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 gained nearly 470.45 points to settle at 25,388.90.

Explained: Why Granules India shares crashed nearly 17% todayGranules India stock price: With this drop, the stock now trades roughly 22% below its all-time high of Rs 724.55, reached earlier in the month

PwC to cut 1,800 jobs in first major layoff since 2009The layoff affects approximately 2.5% of the company's US workforce and impacts a range of positions, including associates, managing directors, and employees in business services, audit, and tax departments.
Sensex surges 1,000 points, Nifty rises; investors add Rs 5 lakh croreThe S&P BSE Sensex added1048.49 points to 82,571.65, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 343.65 points to 25,262.10.
Petrol, diesel prices may fall if crude oil rates remain low: ReportCrude oil prices have recently dropped to their lowest point in nearly three years, bringing some hope for lower fuel prices.

Ayushman Bharat: Senior citizens aged 70 and above to get these benefitsAyushman Bharat: The expansion aims to ease the financial burden of healthcare for the elderly, who often face high medical expenses.

HDFC Bank in talks with global banks to sell loans worth Rs 8,400 crore: ReportFor HDFC Bank, offloading these loans would help improve that ratio, which has deteriorated as credit growth has outpaced deposit accumulation in recent years.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO allotment: Check application status and latest GMPIf you've applied for the Bajaj Housing Finance IPO, you can check your allotment status online in a few simple steps through the websites if the BSE and KFin Technologies.

Kross Limited IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusKross Limited IPO allotment: Investors who applied for the IPO can check their allotment status online through the BSE portal or on Kfin Technologies Limited, the registrar for the issue.

Explained: Why everyone wants a piece of Bajaj Housing Finance IPOBoth big and small, investors rushed in to grab their share of this Rs 6,560-crore IPO, which has attracted a whopping Rs 3.2 lakh crore in bids.

Zomato shares jump 4% to hit all-time high. Will it gain further? Zomato shares hit a record high of Rs 283.50 on the Bombay Stock Exchange. Can the stock continue its upward streak? Read on to find out.

Ayushman Bharat to cover senior citizens above 70: All you need to knowThe expansion of the Ayushman Bharat scheme aims to address the healthcare needs of the elderly, who often face higher medical expenses as they age.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO sees Rs 3.2 lakh crore bids, GMP crosses 100%Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Before the public issue, Bajaj Housing Finance managed to raise Rs 1,758 crore from 104 anchor investors.

New toll collection explained: How GNSS will change your highway experienceUnder the new rules, the GNSS will automatically grant exemptions for travel up to 20 km per day, charging toll fees only for the distance travelled beyond this limit.

Thematic mutual funds explained: Are they the right bet for investors?Thematic funds have outpaced traditional categories in popularity. But what are they, and why are AMCs launching so many? Here's what you need to know.

Mutual funds sahi hai? Why so many Indians are betting big on SIPsIt took 50 years to build Rs 10 lakh crore in AUM from 1963 to 2013, but in just six more years, it reached Rs 23 lakh crore by 2019. As of August 2024, the AUM has tripled to Rs 66.70 lakh crore, demonstrating strong investor confidence.

Sensex dips 400 points, Nifty ends below 25,000; Tata Motors tanks 6%The S&P BSE Sensex fell 398.13 points to 81,523.16 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 122.65 points to settle at 24,918.45.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Veteran CPM leader Sitaram Yechury dies at 72 after prolonged illnessCPI(M) general secretary Sitaram Yechury died on Thursday following prolonged illness. Top political leaders including Rahul Gandhia and Mamata Banerjee condoled his death.

PM Modi at Chief Justice's home for Ganpati Puja sparks rowTop government sources told India Today that the CJI had sent invites to several dignitaries, including the Prime Minister, for the Ganpati Puja.

No live telecast, 15-member delegation: Bengal invites doctors for 5 pm meetThe letter written by West Bengal Chief Secretary Manoj Pant accepted the doctors' demand for Mamata Banerjee's presence at the meeting, but rejected their prerequisite of a live telecast of the talks.

Internet roasts Narayana Murthy again for his 'insights' on good parentingNarayana Murthy said that parents are responsible for creating a disciplined environment at home for children to study. His statement has triggered the internet.

LIVE: Polaris Dawn commander steps out in space for historic spacewalkPolaris Dawn Mission LIVE: The Polaris Dawn crew, consisting of four civilian astronauts led by billionaire Jared Isaacman, is set to create history as they conduct the world's first private spacewalk.

Army officers thrashed, woman friend gang-raped in Madhya PradeshThe incident happened when the two Major rank officers, who were undergoing training at Army War College in Madhya Pradesh's Mhow, were out on a picnic with their two female friends on September 11.

Indian-origin Israeli soldier killed in West Bank attackA 24-year-old Indian-origin Israeli soldier from the Bnei Menashe community was killed in a vehicle-ramming attack near Beit El settlement in the West Bank. The soldier, Staff Sergeant Geri Gideon Hanghal, was a member of the Kfir Brigade's Nahshon Battalion.
Semi-naked, headless body of woman found on Kanpur-Delhi highwayUttar Pradesh Police said the woman's bones and teeth were broken. The police are yet to make a breakthrough in the case.

Can the Chief Justice of India be influenced so easily?Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud's residence for Ganpati puja. Shiv Sena (UBT) leader attacked the CJI's credibility over the meeting. Does the thick line separating the judiciary and the executive get blurred if the CJI meets the PM at a social or religious event?

Muslim panel offers Shimla civic body to demolish 'illegal' portion of mosqueShehzaad, the Imam of the Sanjauli mosque, said the Muslims want to stay in peace and have offered to demolish the alleged unauthorised portion of the mosque.

Farooq Abdullah jabs BJP on IC 814 hijack: Told them not to release terroristsFarooq Abdullah was Chief Minister of Jammu and Kashmir when the Delhi-bound IC 814 was hijacked in December 1999. As per the demands of the hijackers, the Centre released terrorists Maulana Masood Azhar, Ahmed Omar Saeed Sheikh, and Mushtaq Ahmed Zargar.

Golden Retriever's reaction to Trump's 'immigrants eating dogs' remark goes viralA Golden Retriever's reaction to Donald Trump's claim, that dogs are being eaten by immigrants in Springfield, Ohio, has gone viral on social media.

Extremely worrying: Rahul Gandhi condemns attack on Army officers, rape of friendRahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra have criticised the BJP for its handling of law and order, following an attack on two Army officers and the rape of one of their friends in Madhya Pradesh.

Company challenges suspension of eye drops claiming to replace reading glassesEntod Pharmaceuticals denies making false claims about their new PresVu eye drops and plans to challenge the suspension by the Drugs Controller General of India of its manufacturing and sales permission in court.

Manipur Police has procured machine guns, but why?Manipur Police has procured 7.62 mm medium machine guns (MMGs) and requested the Army to train its personnel in their use. The procurement, amid rising drone and missile attacks by militants on civilians, raises questions about why the Manipur Police is getting armed with a weapon not generally used by the police or paramilitary forces.

Anil Mehta's last words to daughter Malaika before his death: I'm sick and tiredAnil Mehta, 65, died on Wednesday morning by jumping from the sixth-floor balcony of his residence in Bandra. Mehta's wife, Joyce Polycarp, was in their flat at Ayesha Manor in Bandra when the incident took place.

Bangladesh asks Hindus to pause Durga Puja music during namaz, azanBangladesh's Home Affairs Adviser said that the local puja committees have been asked to avoid playing musical instruments during azan and namaz, adding that organisers have agreed to the request.

Why cat-saviour Trump can't stand cat-lady TaylorThe 2024 US presidential election has turned into a catfight of sorts. While Donald Trump spoke of a cat-eating population in the US, Taylor Swift called herself a "cat-lady" in her endorsement note for Kamala Harris. But here's why "cat-saviour" Trump is not a fan of the "cat-lady" pop singer.
Stress is good for sperm. A new study says soA new study reveals that stress impacts sperm motility, or its ability to move through the female reproductive system to fertilise an egg.

Ayushman Bharat to cover senior citizens above 70: All you need to knowThe expansion of the Ayushman Bharat scheme aims to address the healthcare needs of the elderly, who often face higher medical expenses as they age.

Rain batters Delhi, more showers likely till weekend; UP, Uttarakhand on alertA depression that is currently lying over central India is expected to bring significant rainfall across Delhi, Haryana, parts of Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand and parts of Madhya Pradesh (MP) between September 11 to 15.

iPhone 16 series will be available for pre-booking on September 13, here is how you can book Apple has unveiled its new iPhone 16 series, featuring advanced A18 processors and Apple Intelligence. Pre-booking begins on September 13 in India, with prices starting at Rs 79,900.

Rahul Bose on Hema Committee report: Opportunity for others to look withinBollywood actor Rahul Bose, in an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.In, advocated for the formation of Hema Committee-like bodies across various industries to combat sexual harassment, emphasising the need for systemic change and fearless action.

Housefull 5: Jacqueliene Fernandez, Chitrangadha Singh and others join the franchiseThe much-anticipated comedy franchise 'Housefull' is back with 'Housefull 5'. Producer Sajid Nadiadwala has announced a star-studded cast, including Jacqueline Fernandez, Nargis Fakhri, and Chitrangda Singh.

Rakul Preet Singh 'cried' after being replaced in Prabhas's filmActor Rakul Preet Singh recalled a time when she was replaced in films starring Tollywood superstar Prabhas. She shared that she was sacked without any prior notice, which led to the industry developing a negative perception of her.

Fardeen Khan on father Feroz Khan's legacy: If Qurbani didn't work...Actor Fardeen Khan reflects on his father Feroz Khan's legacy, revealing that if Qurbani had failed, they would have lost everything. He praises his father's influence and resilience.

sports.headline: Shakib Al Hasan warms up for India Tests with 5-wicket haul in CountyIND vs BAN: Shakib Al Hasan wrecked the Somerset batting lineup after picking up a five-wicket haul. He also warmed up for Bangladesh's upcoming series against India.

Former England boss Gareth Southgate in no hurry to take new jobFormer England manager Gareth Southgate has claimed that he is in no hurry to take a new job as he wants to take some time off and reset. Southgate left the England job after the Euro 2024 campaign.

Mikel Arteta extends Arsenal contract until 2027Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has signed a new three-year contract, keeping him at the club until 2027. The extension underscores the club's faith in his leadership as they aim for their first Premier League title since 2004.

OTD in 2023: Rohit Sharma surpasses Sachin to become 2nd fastest to 10,000 runsRohit Sharma became the second fastest to reach 10,000 ODI runs during the Asia Cup 2023 against Sri Lanka. He achieved the milestone in 241 innings, surpassing Sachin Tendulkar's record.

Rohan Bopanna all set to make debut in Tennis Premier League Season 6Rohan Bopanna is all set to make his debut in the Tennis Premier League season 6. Bopanna will be one of the big names involved with the league this season.

Australia call up Ben Dwarshuis after Xavier Bartlett's side strainENG vs AUS: Ben Dwarshuis has been added as a cover to the Australian squad after Xavier Bartlett suffered a side strain in the first T20I on Wednesday in Southampton.

Kishan shines with hundred after late inclusion in India C in Duleep TrophyDuleep Trophy 2024: Ishan Kishan shone with the bat on his return to the Duleep Trophy for India C against India B in Anantapur. He notched up his 7th first-class hundred within 119 balls.

ISL 2024 fixtures, teams, players to look out for: All you need to knowThe 2024-2025 ISL season kicks off on September 13, featuring exciting matchups, new teams, and rising stars. Defending champions Mumbai City FC face Mohunbagan Super Giants in a highly anticipated opener.

AFG vs SA: Rashid Khan returns as Afghanistan pick new faces for ODI seriesStar all-rounder Rashid Khan makes a return as Afghanistan announce their squad for the upcoming ODI series against South Africa on September 12. Rashid last played in the T20 World Cup.

Thank you for your support: PM Modi receives signed shirt from Paralympic heroesParis Paralympics: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was gifted a special shirt by India's Paralympic heroes, who thanked him for the government's support. PM Modi hosted India's champion para-athletes at his residence in New Delhi on September 12. India won a record-breaking tally of 29 medals at the Paralympics.

Tottenham Hotspur's Bentancur charged by FA over Son Heung-min commentsThe Football Association (FA) has charged Tottenham Hotspur's Rodrigo Bentancur for improper comments about teammate Son Heung-min. Bentancur apologised, but the FA cited an aggravated breach involving race and nationality.

PM Modi hosted India's champion para-athletes at his residence in New Delhi on September 12. India won a record-breaking tally of 29 medals at the Paralympics.

Tottenham Hotspur's Bentancur charged by FA over Son Heung-min commentsThe Football Association (FA) has charged Tottenham Hotspur's Rodrigo Bentancur for improper comments about teammate Son Heung-min. Bentancur apologised, but the FA cited an aggravated breach involving race and nationality.

Indian Hockey team secure semi-finals spot after 3-1 win over KoreaIndia continued their dominant run in the Asian Champions Trophy, securing a 3-1 victory over Korea and securing a spot in the semi-finals. The defending champions, led by Harmanpreet Singh, remain unbeaten, setting the stage for a crucial clash against Pakistan.

PM Modi hosts Paralympic heroes, Avani Lekhara gifts shirt with special messagePrime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the Indian Paralympians on Thursday, September 12 at his residence. PM Modi interacted with medalists and posed for photos. Shooter Avani Lekhara gifted the Prime Minister a signed shirt with a 'thank you' message.

Pakistan Champions Cup Live Streaming: All you need to knowChampions Cup 2024: The One-Day Cup in Pakistan is set to take place from September 12 to 29. Babar Azam, Shaheen Shah Afridi and Haris Rauf are some of the big players who will be a part of the tournament.

Despite twisting ankle, Tom Banton limps out to bat in heroic effortSomerset batter Tom Banton came out to bat with a twisted ankle as his team was looking to fight against Surrey in the Championship Division One match in Taunton.

Competing with McGurk, Matt Short keen on taking David Warner's spot in T20I sideEngland vs Australia: Seasoned opener Matthew Short said he is looking forward to making the most of the opportunities at the opening spot. Short, who hit 41 off just 26 balls in a whirlwind 86-run stand with Travis Head on Wednesday, is competing with young sensation Jake Fraser-McGurk for the opening role.

How can India reach World Test Championship 2025 final at Lord's: ExplainedIndia will kick off their crucial home Test season on September 19, aiming to solidify their position in the World Test Championship standings. With 10 Test matches ahead, the Rohit Sharma-led side currently tops the points table.

Ronaldo's fresh jibe at Erik ten Hag: Guys in office can't bring gloryCristiano Ronaldo reignited tensions with Manchester United by criticizing Erik ten Hag's management, suggesting the coach lacks the winning mentality needed for the club's success, while urging a deeper connection with United's heritage and expectations.

Ruturaj Gaikwad retires hurt after twisting his ankle in Duleep Trophy matchDuleep Trophy 2024: India C captain Ruturaj Gaikwad retired hurt after twisting his left ankle while batting against India B. Gaikwad could manage to face only two balls before departing.

Short, who hit 41 off just 26 balls in a whirlwind 86-run stand with Travis Head on Wednesday, is competing with young sensation Jake Fraser-McGurk for the opening role.

Ruturaj Gaikwad retires hurt after twisting his ankle in Duleep Trophy matchDuleep Trophy 2024: India C captain Ruturaj Gaikwad retired hurt after twisting his left ankle while batting against India B. Gaikwad could manage to face only two balls before departing.

Chess Olympiad: Praggnanandhaa, Vaishali star as Indian teams start strongChess Olympiad 2024: D Gukesh and Harika sat out of the opening round, but India men's and women's teams did not have any trouble winning their opening round ties in Budapest.

Ronaldo's advice to Ten Hag for United rebuild: Talk to Van NistelrooyCristiano Ronaldo reignites tension with Erik ten Hag, advising the Manchester United coach to seek guidance from Ruud van Nistelrooy while questioning his readiness to compete at the top level, despite expressing love for the club.

Greater Noida Test set to join rare list after rain washes out 4th day Afghanistan (AFG) vs New Zealand (NZ), one-off Test: Rain washed out the fourth successive day of the Test match in Greater Noida. The one-off match is heading towards a rare abandonment without a ball bowled.

Bangladesh announce squad for India Tests, show faith in Pakistan-beating unitThe Bangladesh Cricket Board announced a 16-member squad for the 2-match Test series against India, starting September 19. The BCB showcased faith in the Pakistan-beating unit for the Test series against India.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
